synopsis: Gets metrics for the Azure website in the current subscription.

inputs.description: You can pass input to this cmdlet by property name, but not by value.

outputs.description: By default, Get-AzureWebsiteMetric returns an array of MetricResponse objects.

examples.title: Example 1: Get metrics for the last three hours on a per-instance level for a website
examples.code:
PS C:\>Get-AzureWebsiteMetric -Name "ContosoWebSite" -StartDate (get-date).AddHours(-3) -MetricNames "Requests" -InstanceDetails -SlotView -TimeGrain "PT1M"
$metrics[1].Data Name : Requests

Unit : Count

StartTime : 8/11/2014 7:05:00 AM

EndTime : 8/11/2014 5:06:01 PM

TimeGrain : PT1M
PrimaryAggregationType : Instance
Values : {Time:8/11/2014 7:05:00 AM, Total:4, Min:, Max:, Time:8/11/2014 7:06:00 AM, Total:3, Min:, Max:,
Time:8/11/2014 7:07:00 AM, Total:3, Min:, Max:, Time:8/11/2014 7:08:00 AM, Total:12, Min:, Max:...}
$metrics[1].Data.Values | ft
TimeCreated Total Minimum Maximum Count InstanceName
----------- ----- ------- ------- ----- ------------
8/11/2014 7:05:00 AM 4 1 RD00155DC24599
8/11/2014 7:06:00 AM 3 1 RD00155DC24599
8/11/2014 7:07:00 AM 3 1 RD00155DC24589
8/11/2014 7:08:00 AM 12 1 RD00155DC24599
8/11/2014 7:09:00 AM 37 1 RD00155DC24599
8/11/2014 7:10:00 AM 9 1 RD00155DC24599
examples.remarks: This command gets metrics for the last three hours on a per-instance level for a website.

parameters.name: EndDate
parameters.description: Specifies the time, as a DateTime object, to stop getting metrics. To obtain a DateTime object, use the Get-Date cmdlet. For more information, type Get-Help Get-Date.

parameters.name: InstanceDetails
parameters.description: Indicates that this cmdlet includes details on a per-instance level. If the web hosting plan runs on two or more computers, this cmdlet returns metrics for each computer.

parameters.name: MetricNames
parameters.description: Specifies an array of metrics to get. If you do not specify this parameter, the cmdlet gets all metrics.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: Specifies the name of a website in the subscription. This parameter does not support wildcard characters.

parameters.name: Slot
parameters.description: Specifies the environment of a cloud service deployment. Valid values are: Production and Staging.

parameters.name: SlotView
parameters.description: Indicates that this cmdlet gets metrics for the host names that receive traffic at the current slot. If a swap occurs during the time period, the metrics are merged.

parameters.name: StartDate
parameters.description: Specifies the time, as a DateTime object, to start getting metrics.

parameters.name: TimeGrain
parameters.description:
Specifies the time unit for metrics. Valid values are:
-- PT1M (Minute)
-- PT1H (Hour)
-- P1D (Day)

The default value is PT1H.

name: Get-AzureWebsiteMetric
description:
This topic describes the cmdlet in the 0.8.10 version of the Microsoft Azure PowerShell module. To get the version of the module you're using, in the Azure PowerShell console, type (Get-Module -Name Azure).Version.
The Get-AzureWebsiteMetric cmdlet gets metrics for the Azure website in the current subscription.
